description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, March 12, 2020:
The Hungarian Government issues a decree which, among other things, states that:
- "students shall be prohibited from entering higher education institutions" (as per §4b of the source document)
- "no extraordinary break may be ordered in public education institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority for the purpose of coordinated protection" (as per §4c of the source document)
- "the Language Learning Programme Abroad [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] shall be suspended" (as per §4e of the source document). The policy doesn't mention an end date.

description:
Hungary, March 27, 2020:
The Ministry for Innovation and Technology asks the heads of higher education institutions to uphold the ban on entering universities and colleges of higher education, although the previous measure ensuring this has expired. "[S]tudents at universities and colleges will continue to be taught via distance teaching next week", the Ministry states.

description:
Hungary, March 27, 2020:
The Hungarian Government issues a decree which states that ongoing training courses shall be suspended for the duration of the state of emergency. During the duration of the state of emergency, vocational training may be organised exclusively in the form of distance learning or digital training, even if this is not otherwise permitted by law or other agreements. The organisation of vocational examinations shall be suspended indefinitely. There is no explicit end date.

description:
Hungary, April 2, 2020:
In addition to the ban on entering educational institutions (with the exception of childcare which is still available in small groups), implied by the nation-wide lockdown initiated on March 28:
- "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" (exceptions are formulated in section 4)
- "the Foreign Language Learning Programme [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] is suspended", as per § 6, section 6 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet".
The lockdown expires on April 11, 2020. The policies mentioned in "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" have no explicit end date.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government proceeds to implement a nation-wide lockdown and for this purpose closes all schools. Childcare is still available in small groups. Higher education institutions may be visited by students if the necessary conditions for maintaining the protective distance are provided for, as stated in Government Decree 168/2020. Additionally, Government Decree 81/2020 states that:
- "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" (exceptions are formulated in section 4)
- "the Foreign Language Learning Programme [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] is suspended", as per § 6, section 6 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet".
There is no explicit end date to these policies.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet".
The lockdown expires on April 11, 2020. The policies mentioned in "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" have no explicit end date. UPDATE: From May 4, 2020, higher education institutions may be visited by students as decided by the rector. The dormitories of higher education institutions remain closed. The necessary conditions for maintaining the protective distance are to be provided.

description:
Hungary, May 12, 2020:
The Hungarian Government issues a decree which states that contact hour training and vocational/central module final examinations shall be suspended. For the duration of the state of emergency, vocational training and final module examinations may be organised primarily in the form of distance learning or digital training, even if this is not otherwise permitted by law or other agreements. Training and professional examinations which are necessary to avert or mitigate the consequences of an emergency as determined by the Operational Task Force for Coronavirus Epidemic Response may be held physically. According to §2, 1b, specific training which requires personal presence need not be held in a distance format. There is no explicit end date to this policy.

description:
Hungary, March 27, 2020:
The Hungarian Government issues a decree which states that ongoing training courses shall be suspended for the duration of the state of emergency. During the duration of the state of emergency, vocational training may be organised exclusively in the form of distance learning or digital training, even if this is not otherwise permitted by law or other agreements. The organisation of vocational examinations shall be suspended indefinitely. There is no explicit end date. UPDATE: From May 12, 2020, examinations may be organised in a distance form. Training and professional examinations which are necessary to avert or mitigate the consequences of an emergency as determined by the Operational Task Force for Coronavirus Epidemic Response may be held physically. According to §2, 1b, specific training which requires personal presence need not be held in a distance format.

description:
Hungary, May 4, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government proceeds to implement a nation-wide lockdown and for this purpose closes all schools. Childcare is still available in small groups. Higher education institutions may be visited by students if the necessary conditions for maintaining the protective distance are provided for, as stated in Government Decree 168/2020. Additionally, Government Decree 81/2020 states that:
- "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" (exceptions are formulated in section 4)
- "the Foreign Language Learning Programme [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] is suspended", as per § 6, section 6 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet".
There is no explicit end date to these policies. UPDATE: Government Decree 168/2020 is extended on May 18, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Number of people on the school premises are limited (e.g. only 50 people allowed on school premises)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, May 27, 2020:
The Hungarian Government issues a decree which states that contact hour training and vocational/final module examinations may be organised in compliance with the epidemiological rules. No person over 65 years of age may take part in contact hour training or in the work of the examination board, though. Training and examinations may still be organised and completed by distance learning, distance education or digital training. A distance/digital format is to be preferred if possible. There is no explicit end date to this policy.

description:
Hungary, June 2, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government declares that all kindergartens and nurseries shall operate in the normal way before the emergency situation. As per § 1, section 3, kindergartens and crèches may close for a maximum of two weeks until 31 August 2020. As per § 3, children's and youth camps may be organised both as day care and overnight camps from June 16, 2020. Additionally, Government Decree 81/2020 states that, "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet". This policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, June 2, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government declares that schools may organize individual or small group sessions in their premises for the purpose of catching up pupils. Generally, schools shall continue to operate according to the digital extra-curricular work schedule from 2 June to 15 June, 2020. Between 2 June and 26 June, 2020, all primary and secondary schools shall organise the supervision of pupils. Institutional childcare shall be provided in schools until 26 June 2020. For unsupervised pupils, childcare shall be provided during the school holidays.

(IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" (exceptions are formulated in section 4)
- "the Foreign Language Learning Programme [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] is suspended", as per § 6, section 6 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet".
There is no explicit end date to these policies. UPDATE: From June 2, 2020, pupils may enter school buildings for educational purposes in exceptional cases.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 25, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government proceeds to implement a nation-wide lockdown and for this purpose closes all schools. Kindergartens and nurseries can operate in the normal way before the emergency situation. Higher education institutions may be visited by students if the necessary conditions for maintaining the protective distance are provided for, as stated in Government Decree 168/2020. Additionally, Government Decree 81/2020 states that:
- "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet" (exceptions are formulated in section 4)
- "the Foreign Language Learning Programme [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] is suspended", as per § 6, section 6 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet".
There is no explicit end date to these policies. UPDATE: From June 2, 2020, pupils may enter school buildings for educational purposes in exceptional cases.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

institution_status: Secondary Schools closed/locked down

description:
Hungary, June 2, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government declares that all kindergartens and nurseries shall operate in the normal way before the emergency situation. As per § 1, section 3, kindergartens and crèches may close for a maximum of two weeks until 31 August 2020. As per § 3, children's and youth camps may be organised both as day care and overnight camps from June 16, 2020. Additionally, Government Decree 81/2020 states that, "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet". This policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: On June 8, 2020, this policy was extended according to § 5 of the source document.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with no conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines

description:
Hungary, June 2, 2020:
The Hungarian National Government declares that schools may organize individual or small group sessions in their premises for the purpose of catching up pupils. Generally, schools shall continue to operate according to the digital extra-curricular work schedule from 2 June to 15 June, 2020. Between 2 June and 26 June, 2020, all primary and secondary schools shall organise the supervision of pupils. School meals shall be provided in schools until 26 June 2020. For unsupervised pupils, school meals shall be provided during the school holidays.
Additionally, Government Decree 81/2020 states that: - "for the purpose of coordinated protection, no extraordinary break may be ordered in public upbringing institutions by their heads, the local government clerk or the Educational Authority", as per § 6, section 3 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "the Foreign Language Learning Programme [Külföldi Nyelvtanulási Program] is suspended", as per § 6, section 6 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet"
- "school trips abroad are prohibited, and school trips abroad that have already been booked must be cancelled", as per § 6, section 7 of the source document "81/2020. (IV. 1.) Korm. rendelet". UPDATE: On June 16, 2020, this policy was extended according to § 5 of the source document.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, May 27, 2020:
The Hungarian Government issues a decree which states that contact hour training and vocational/final module examinations may be organised in compliance with the epidemiological rules. No person over 65 years of age may take part in contact hour training or in the work of the examination board, though. Training and examinations may still be organised and completed by distance learning, distance education or digital training. A distance/digital format is to be preferred if possible. There is no explicit end date to this policy. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020.

description: Schools and universities in Hungary will start the academic year in a regular manner as of September 1, 2020, but have to follow a protocol concerning coronavirus prevention. UPDATE: Hungary closed universities and secondary schools as of November 11, 2020. For students over the age of 14 (8th grade in high schools), digital education will be introduced. Nurseries, kindergartens, and primary schools will remain open to those under 14 years of age. School and kindergarten teachers and nursery staff will be tested on a weekly, targeted basis.

description:
Hungary, November 12, 2020:
The National Government decides to simplify and speed up the regulatory procedure for the procurement and licensing of vaccines and effective antiviral medicines: The National Institute of Pharmacy and Food Safety may temporarily authorise the domestic use of a medicine authorised in a third country to prevent the spread of coronavirus, provided that the product is of good quality and the tests carried out show it to be effective. The authorisation will be granted for a fixed period of up to six months, which may be extended for a further period of up to six months in particularly justified cases. The policy is slated to end on February 8, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Regulatory approval process for administering the COVID-19 vaccine

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, November 26, 2020:
The Ministry of Interior publishes its plan for prioritising vaccination. Accordingly, health and social care workers will be the first to receive vaccination against SARS-CoV-2, followed by persons belonging to a risk group, critical infrastructure workers and all 18-59 year olds not in the other risk groups.

description:
Hungary started pre-registration for the coronavirus vaccine on Dec.08,2020.State Secretary Csaba Dömötör said those that pre-register will also get up-to-date information about the epidemic and about when they can expect to get vaccinated. He said medically vulnerable groups and those in front-line jobs will get priority in access to vaccination.
For the pre-registration the government set up the Website "/vakcinainfo.gov.hu/"

description:

Hungary, January 22, 2021:
Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade Péter Szijjártó said that Hungarian authorities have purchased the Russian Sputnik V vaccine, enough of it to vaccinate one million people against the coronavirus. description: Hungary's government has decided to introduce certificates of immunity from coronavirus for people who have been inoculated or recovered from Covid-19, the prime minister’s chief of staff said on Feb.11,2021. Gergely Gulyás said that the certificate would be issued to people who have received the second shot of the vaccine, and indicate the date of administering the second jab. Those recovered from Covid-19 will be issued a certificate indicating the date of their release from hospital or their first negative PCR after their infection, or the tenth day after their first positive PCR test result. The certificates would be provided free of charge.

description:
Hungary, January 28, 2021:
Prime Minister Viktor Orbán announced on December 18 that a first round of vaccinations against the coronavirus will most likely begin on 27 or 28 December (actually began on December 26). Health workers will be vaccinated first. The vaccination will be voluntary and free of charge. Vaccinations are distributed at 25 vaccination points in the country. From January 7, 2021, residents of nursing homes will also receive the vaccine. On January 28, 2021, it was announced that the next target group in the vaccination schedule will be the oldest people registered for vaccination. UPDATE: From April 25, 2021, anyone who has not yet been vaccinated and has a valid registration can book an appointment online for their vaccination. The Sinopharm vaccine will be used here. Vaccinations will be given at hospital vaccination points.

description:
Hungary started pre-registration for the coronavirus vaccine on Dec.08,2020.State Secretary Csaba Dömötör said those that pre-register will also get up-to-date information about the epidemic and about when they can expect to get vaccinated. He said medically vulnerable groups and those in front-line jobs will get priority in access to vaccination.
For the pre-registration the government set up the Website "/vakcinainfo.gov.hu/"
Update2: Registration for non-citizens, Hungarians living abroad, and repatriated Hungarians who do not yet have a TAJ(public health insurance) card opened on Tuesday. People wishing to be vaccinated can register on www.vakcinainfo.gov.hu. UPDATE: Originally only Hungarian citizens residing in Hungary were eligible for the Covid-Vaccine,as of Tuesday May.4,2021 Vaccination registration has opened to foreigners living in Hungary, ethnic Hungarians living in other countries, and recently repatriated Hungarians, the government’s information center announced. A Hungarian health (TAJ) card is not required.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Voluntary/Recommended but No Penalties

He said medically vulnerable groups and those in front-line jobs will get priority in access to vaccination.

Update: Starting with May.17, 2021 Hungarians living outside of Hungary can also register for the coronavirus vaccine in Hungary if they are unable to get vaccinated in the country where they reside. UPDATE: Originally the registration for the Covid-Vaccine was only open for citizens living in Hungary, now it has been extended to all hungarian citizens living insied or outsied of Hungary. description:
Hungary, March 15, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from the territories of Italy, China, South Korea, Israel and Iran may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from the territory of these countries shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. EEA nationals as per § 8 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals.
There are exceptions to these provisions.
No explicit end date is mentioned.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, March 15, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from the territories of Italy, China, South Korea, Israel and Iran may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from the territory of these countries shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. EEA nationals as per § 8 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals.
There are exceptions to these provisions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From March 17, 2020, all non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad may not enter the territory of Hungary.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry),Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, April 2, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals.
There are various exceptions to this provision. 
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, April 2, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals.
There are various exceptions to this provision. 
As of April 16, this policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: From April 2, 2020, all border crossings on the Hungarian-Austrian border and the Balassagyarmat crossing between Slovakia and Hungary have been re-opened to commuters with jobs on either side of the border. At Balassagyarmat, crossing is only allowed to those with a residence within 30 km of the border. There are no such restrictions on the Austria-Hungary border.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Hungary, May 14, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Austria at specific times.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian and Austrian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove by a document in English or Hungarian, issued not more than 4 days prior to entry and containing the result of a molecular biological test, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. EEA nationals as per § 3 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove by a document in English or Hungarian, issued not more than 4 days prior to entry and containing the result of a molecular biological test, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Hungary, May 14, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Austria at specific times.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: From May 22, 2020, all Romanian-Hungarian border crossings reopen.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Hungary, May 25, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove with the result of a molecular biological test that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Serbian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Serbia without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove by a document in English or Hungarian, issued not more than 4 days prior to entry and containing the result of a molecular biological test, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: Government Decree 226/2020 declares that, from May 25, Serbian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Serbia without any restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Hungary, May 27, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian and Austrian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove by a document in English or Hungarian, issued not more than 4 days prior to entry and containing the result of a molecular biological test, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. A Hungarian citizen may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Austria if he/she can establish that the final destination of his/her departure was the Czech Republic and his/her stay there did not exceed 48 hours, as per § 3, section 2 of Government Decree 235/2020. EEA nationals as per § 3 of Government Decree 216/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, May 27, 2020:
The National Government declares that citizens from the Czech Republic and Slovakia may enter Hungary if their stay in Hungary does not exceed 48 hours. Czech and Slovak nationals residing in the territory of Hungary shall be obliged to leave the territory of Hungary within 48 hours of entry. Hungarian citizens may enter the territory of Hungary from the territory of the Czech Republic or the Slovak Republic if their stay in the Czech Republic or Slovakia has not exceeded 48 hours. EEA nationals as per § 4 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, May 25, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove with the result of a molecular biological test that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Serbian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Serbia without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: § 3, section 2 of Government Decree 235/2020 states that, from May 27, 2020, "a Hungarian citizen may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Austria if he/she can establish that the final destination of his/her departure was the Czech Republic and his/her stay there did not exceed 48 hours".
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, May 25, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove with the result of a molecular biological test that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Serbian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Serbia without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: Government Decree 243/2020 declares that, from May 28, Slovenian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Slovenia without any restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, May 30, 2020:
The National Government declares that Bulgarian citizens and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Bulgaria may enter the territory of Hungary if they can prove with reasonable grounds, in particular by presenting an invitation letter, official passport or work contract, that the purpose of their stay in the territory of Hungary is (a) the performance of official duties, (b) to participate in the activities of an international organisation, (c) a business trip, (d) humanitarian activities, or (e) visiting a relative. Hungarian citizens may enter the territory of Hungary from the territory of Romania if they can prove that the destination of their journey is Bulgaria for one of the purposes set out in points a) to e). EEA nationals as per § 4 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, May 27, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian and Austrian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove by a document in English or Hungarian, issued not more than 4 days prior to entry and containing the result of a molecular biological test, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. A Hungarian citizen may enter Hungary from the territory of the Republic of Austria if he/she can establish that the final destination of his/her departure was the Czech Republic and his/her stay there did not exceed 48 hours, as per § 3, section 2 of Government Decree 235/2020. EEA nationals as per § 3 of Government Decree 216/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy was repealed on June 5, 2020.

description:
Hungary, May 27, 2020:
The National Government declares that citizens from the Czech Republic and Slovakia may enter Hungary if their stay in Hungary does not exceed 48 hours. Czech and Slovak nationals residing in the territory of Hungary shall be obliged to leave the territory of Hungary within 48 hours of entry. Hungarian citizens may enter the territory of Hungary from the territory of the Czech Republic or the Slovak Republic if their stay in the Czech Republic or Slovakia has not exceeded 48 hours. EEA nationals as per § 4 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy was repealed on June 5, 2020.

description:
Hungary, June 8, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Croatian, German, Serbian, Slovenian, Austrian, Czech and Slovak citizens as well as Hungarian citizens arriving from these countries may enter the territory of Hungary without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

description:
Hungary, June 8, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Croatian, German, Serbian, Slovenian, Austrian, Czech and Slovak citizens as well as Hungarian citizens arriving from these countries may enter the territory of Hungary without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, May 28, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Austrian and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Austria may enter Hungary if they can prove with the result of a PCR test that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Serbian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from Serbia without any restrictions. Slovenian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from Slovenia without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: From June 8, 2020, Croatian, German, Austrian, Czech and Slovak citizens as well as Hungarian citizens arriving from these countries may enter the territory of Hungary without any restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, April 2, 2020:
The National Government declares that health workers, soldiers, defence personnel, members of the professional service, employees under Act CXXII of 2010 and government officials under Act CXXV of 2018 may leave the territory of Hungary only with the special permission of the responsible Minister. The policy has no explicit end date. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

Hungary, June 8, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic may not enter the territory of Hungary. Hungarian nationals arriving from abroad through passenger traffic shall undergo a medical examination. Those Hungarian nationals who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during a medical examination and do not reside in Hungary have to leave the territory of Hungary or are to be quarantined. A Hungarian citizen is regarded as non-infectious if it's proven that she/he has recovered from COVID-19 and shows no symptoms of infection, or has been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry, as per § 3, section 2 of the source document. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Romanian and Hungarian citizens may enter Hungary from the territory of Romania provided they submit to a medical examination. Croatian, German, Serbian, Slovenian, Austrian, Czech and Slovak citizens as well as Hungarian citizens arriving from these countries may enter the territory of Hungary without any restrictions.
There are various exceptions to this provision.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: Announced on June 16, 2020, and adopted on June 17, 2020, Romanian citizens as well as Hungarian citizens arriving from Romania may enter the territory of Hungary without any restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, June 18, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad (with the exception of Hungarian citizens as well as EU/EEA nationals (plus citizens from Switzerland) and their family members - however, those from the UK are not exempted) for unofficial purposes are not allowed to enter the territory of Hungary through passenger transport. Those who, for example, work in the health care sector may be exempted if they can prove their respective purpose of entry by means of an application. Those applying have to undergo a medical examination for COVID-19 and are refused entry if they are suspected of having COVID-19. If the health examination does not reveal any suspicion of COVID-19, the person shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days. Serbia shall be the state eligible for entry on the basis of international reciprocity, as per § 1 of the source document "9/2020. (VI. 17.) KKM rendelet". Various exceptions are formulated. The policy has no explicit end date.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, May 30, 2020:
The National Government declares that Bulgarian citizens and Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Bulgaria may enter the territory of Hungary if they can prove with reasonable grounds, in particular by presenting an invitation letter, official passport or work contract, that the purpose of their stay in the territory of Hungary is (a) the performance of official duties, (b) to participate in the activities of an international organisation, (c) a business trip, (d) humanitarian activities, or (e) visiting a relative. Hungarian citizens may enter the territory of Hungary from the territory of Romania if they can prove that the destination of their journey is Bulgaria for one of the purposes set out in points a) to e). EEA nationals as per § 4 of the source document shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: This policy ended on June 18, 2020, as the state of emergency was repealed on this day.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, July 15, 2020:
The National Government classifies countries into different categories. Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from a green country may enter Hungary without any restrictions. The same individuals entering Hungary from a red or yellow country shall be subject to a medical examination upon arrival. Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a green country may enter Hungary without any restrictions. Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a yellow country shall be subject to a medical examination upon arrival. If the health examination reveals a suspicion of infection, individuals shall not be allowed to enter the territory of Hungary. Depending on the result of the medical examination, individuals may be placed in quarantine for 14 days. They need not be quarantined if submitting a negative PCR test result prior to entry. Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from a red country may not enter Hungary.
The list of countries classified as green, yellow or red can be found in the document "Közlemény a COVID-19...".
Various exceptions to these provisions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry.
No explicit end date is mentioned.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Hungary, July 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad (with the exception of Hungarian citizens as well as EU/EEA nationals (plus citizens from Switzerland) and their family members - however, those from the UK are not exempted) for unofficial purposes are not allowed to enter the territory of Hungary through passenger transport. Those who, for example, work in the health care sector may be exempted if they can prove their respective purpose of entry by means of an application. Those applying have to undergo a medical examination for COVID-19 and are refused entry if they are suspected of having COVID-19. If the health examination does not reveal any suspicion of COVID-19, the person shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days. Non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad may enter the territory of Hungary if they are entitled to reside in the territory of Hungary and present a document to this effect upon entry. These individuals are not to be quarantined if they submit a document in Hungarian or English containing the results of a molecular biological test carried out on two occasions within 5 days prior to entry into Hungary showing that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. Various exceptions are formulated. The policy has no explicit end date. UPDATE: This policy was replaced by Government Decree 341/2020 on July 15, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: Announced on September 1, 2020, Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from the territory of the Czech Republic, Poland or Slovakia shall be allowed to enter Hungary if accommodation in these countries was booked before entry into force of Government Decree 419/2020. A negative PCR test may grant a waiver from quarantine orders for these individuals. Czech, Polish and Slovak citizens may enter the territory of Hungary if they can prove reservation for at least one day in a Hungarian accommodation facility on a date no later than 30 September 2020 and that the reservation was made before the entry into force of Government Decree 419/2020. Additionally, they have to submit a negative PCR test upon entry.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

Czech, Polish and Slovak citizens may enter the territory of Hungary if they can prove reservation for at least one day in a Hungarian accommodation facility on a date no later than 30 September 2020 and that the reservation was made before the entry into force of Government Decree 419/2020. Additionally, they have to submit a negative PCR test upon entry.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From September 5, 2020, additional exceptions are introduced according to Government Decree 422/2020.

description:
Hungary, April 29, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From May 10, 2021, individuals under the age of eighteen are allowed to enter Hungary if crossing the Hungarian border with a person that possesses an immunity certificate.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, May 10, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From May 21, 2021, those who enter Hungary for the purpose of requesting the issuance of an immunity certificate may also be exempted from entry restrictions. These provisions also apply to persons under the age of eighteen who are under the supervision of and cross the Hungarian border alongside last-named individuals.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that border controls are re-introduced until October 1, 2020. UPDATE: From May 22, 2021, border controls are extended until June 23, 2021.

description:
Hungary, May 10, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From May 22, 2021, entry restrictions do not apply to those holding an immunity certificate issued by a country in relation to which Hungary unilaterally recognises certificates of immunity, and presenting it upon arrival.

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From May 27, 2021, the entry into Hungary of the crew (flight crew and cabin crew) of any aircraft (Hungarian or non-Hungarian) arriving in Hungary from any foreign state shall in all cases be considered as for business purposes and the crew member may enter the territory of Hungary without any restriction, as per Government Decree 274/2021.

Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries such as Romania.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From June 11, 2021, immunity certificates issued by Ukraine are accepted by the Hungarian authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary closed its borders to all foreigners as of March 16, 2020.
UPDATE: Hungary has opened its Schengen borders on June.23.2021, allowing restriction free travel to anyone entering the country from Croatia, Austria, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, or Slovenia. The announcement only affects the crossing of the physical borders themselves, restrictions for people travelling by airplane remain the same. UPDATE: Originally Hungary closed its borders for all foreigners(with some exceptions in the last months), as of June.23.2021 Hungary opens its Schengen borders allowing restriction free travel to anyone entering the country from Croatia, Austria, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, or Slovenia. But restrictions for people travelling by airplane remain the same.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time)

description:
Hungary, September 1, 2020:
The National Government declares that border controls are re-introduced until October 1, 2020. UPDATE: The policy expired on June 23, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, May 22, 2021:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens and family members of Hungarian citizens who are not Hungarian citizens entering Hungary from abroad have to undergo a medical examination upon entry. Depending on the results of the medical examination, these individuals shall be quarantined differently, as per § 2, section 2 and § 3 of Government Decree 408/2020. Non-Hungarian citizens may not enter the territory of Hungary. However, various exceptions exist. Those who may be exempted for reasons such as attendance at family events have to undergo an application procedure where they can prove their purpose of entry. Those submitting an immunity certificate upon arrival can enter Hungary without any restrictions. Individuals under the age of eighteen crossing the border alongside those with an immunity certificate can also enter Hungary without restrictions. Hungary now unilaterally recognises immunity certificates issued by certain countries.
No explicit end date is mentioned. UPDATE: From August 7, 2021, individuals from the territory of Ukraine may enter Hungary without any restrictions, except in the case of entry by civil aircraft.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, during the state of danger/emergency, authorised warehouse keepers shall be allowed to manufacture disinfectants from alcohol products without partial denaturation. Also, during the state of danger/emergency, the volume of denatured alcohol that can be used exclusively by an authorised warehouse keeper, authorised user or registered user shall be amended to 1 m³.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.

The National Government declares that healthcare institutions and facilities providing permanent or temporary care for the elderly operated with a capacity of at least 200 places are obliged to ensure the protection, maintenance and preservation of the condition of their healthcare supply (equipment, devices, supplies of medicinal products and disinfectants) at all affiliated establishments, with a view to containing the coronavirus epidemic. Police and the Hungarian Defence Forces may be involved in securing the healthcare supply.
The policy's ending is indefinite.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: National Government,Military,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Hungary, March 17, 2020:
The National Government declares that the Minister of Human Capacities, in coordination with the epidemiological authority, is authorised to assess and register data of persons currently participating in some sort of healthcare or social assistance training/education who may be involved in performing tasks relating to a state of healthcare crisis.

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that any source may be used to acquire alcohol necessary for manufacturing biocidal products used for disinfection. Those authorised to manufacture biocidal products shall ensure that quality requirements for manufacturing are always met.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.
 UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, during the state of danger/emergency, authorised warehouse keepers shall be allowed to manufacture disinfectants from alcohol products without partial denaturation. Also, during the state of danger/emergency, the volume of denatured alcohol that can be used exclusively by an authorised warehouse keeper, authorised user or registered user shall be amended to 1 m³.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends.
 UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description:
Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, during the state of danger/emergency, adult persons participating in some sort of healthcare or social assistance training/education may be involved in performing tasks relating to the COVID-19 pandemic. For the period of involvement, persons shall be exempt from their other civil obligations.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.

Hungary, April 4, 2020:
The National Government declares that, during the state of danger/emergency, manufacturers of medicinal products are not obliged to pay the administrative service fee for the approval of their product as long as it is considered to help combating the COVID-19 pandemic.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.

description:
Hungary, April 6, 2020:
The National Government declares that, for the duration of the state of emergency, employees of day nurseries and public education establishments who are under 60 years of age, not chronically ill and who have been exempted from the obligation to work in connection with the pandemic, may be temporarily transferred to work in a social service provider, social institution, temporary care institution for children or child protection institution if a shortage of staff there jeopardises the security of care.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.

Hungary, April 10, 2020:
The National Government declares that, for the duration of the state of emergency, medical oxygen prescribed and delivered to a patient in a residential social institution may also be delivered in the absence of the patient's signature on the prescription and may be accounted for as social security benefits.
The policy ends whenever the state of emergency ends. UPDATE: The policy ended on June 17, 2020, alongside the state of emergency.

description: Hungary announced a partial lockdown from November 11, 2020. A nationwide general curfew will be imposed between 8 p.m. and 5 a.m. with an exception for those commuting to work. Businesses will be required to close by 7 p.m., restaurants will be limited to home delivery, sporting events will be held in empty stadiums, and family gatherings will be limited to 10 people. Universities and high schools will make the transition to digital education, while preschools, kindergartens and classes for children 14 and under will remain open. The restrictions will remain in place for 30 days, after which they may be extended.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: Hungary announced a partial lockdown from November 11, 2020. A nationwide general curfew will be imposed between 8 p.m. and 5 a.m. with an exception for those commuting to work. Businesses will be required to close by 7 p.m., restaurants will be limited to home delivery, sporting events will be held in empty stadiums, and family gatherings will be limited to 10 people. Universities and high schools will make the transition to digital education, while preschools, kindergartens and classes for children 14 and under will remain open. The restrictions will remain in place for 30 days, after which they may be extended. UPDATE: Hungary introduces stricter lockdown measures as of March 8, 2021. Shops, with the exception of food stores, pharmacies and petrol stations, will have to be closed and services, with the exception of private health care, suspended between March 8 and 22. Kindergartens and primary schools will be closed from March 8 until April 7.

description:
Hungary, March 9, 2020:
In response to the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus, Hungarian authorities are instituting quarantine rules. Any foreign patients who refuse to cooperate with the authorities in this matter risk being expelled from the country. People who refuse to cooperate will be detained by the immigration police for six months, which can be extended for another six months, before being deported (HungaryToday, March 9).
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: Hungary is forcing Hungarian citizens returning from Italy, China, South Korea and Iran to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under 'official home quarantine' (designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary) for 14 days. EEA nationals as per § 8 of Government Decree 41/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, March 15, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Italy, China, South Korea, Israel or Iran have to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under official home quarantine (or designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary, respectively) for 14 days. EEA nationals as per § 8 of Government Decree 41/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Exemptions may be granted in cases of special merit. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, March 15, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens arriving from the territory of Italy, China, South Korea, Israel or Iran have to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under official home quarantine (or designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary, respectively) for 14 days. EEA nationals as per § 8 of Government Decree 41/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Exemptions may be granted in cases of special merit. There's no explicit end date for this policy. UPDATE: This policy expired on March 27, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Hungary, April 2, 2020:
The National Government declares that Hungarian citizens arriving by passenger transport from abroad have to undergo designated quarantine if, during the medical examination, they are suspected of being infected with COVID-19. Those who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 during the health examination shall be placed under official home quarantine (or designated quarantine for non-residential Hungarian citizens staying in Hungary, respectively) for 14 days, unless credibly proving that they have recovered from a COVID-19 infection and currently show no symptoms of infection, or have been under epidemiological surveillance for at least 14 days prior to entry. EEA nationals as per § 7 of Government Decree 81/2020 shall be treated in the same way as Hungarian nationals. Exceptions may be granted. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Hungary announced new digital measures for the controlling of the home-quarantine of covid-patients at home on May.04.2020. Hungarian citizens who have to be in home-quarantine beacuse of Covid-Illness will have the opportunity to use a smartphone app (Home Quarantine System) developed to monitor home-quarantine cases. The use of the app is not mandatory, in the case someone doesn't want to use the app the police monitors their compliance with the government-ordered quarantine.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description:
Hungary, June 18, 2020:
The National Government enacts that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad and exempted from entry restrictions shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days upon entry. This policy shall apply to the crossing of the border for unofficial purposes with a private passport and other travel documents. There's no explicit end date for this policy.

description:
Hungary, July 4, 2020:
The National Government enacts that non-Hungarian citizens arriving from abroad and exempted from entry restrictions shall be placed in quarantine or in an official house quarantine designated by the epidemiological authority for 14 days upon entry (designated or official house quarantine for those who, after a medical examination, are not suspected of being infected and designated quarantine for those with a valid residence permit who are tested positive). Those with a valid residence permit who are not suspected of being infected with COVID-19 are not required to undergo quarantine if they can prove, by means of a document in Hungarian or English containing the results of a PCR test carried out on two occasions within 5 days prior to entry into Hungary and in accordance with professional health regulations, that no SARS-CoV-2 virus is currently detectable in their body. This policy shall apply to the crossing of the border for unofficial purposes with a private passport and other travel documents. There's no explicit end date for this policy.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)
